DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the erythrocyte transfusion dependence.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm and little else; biconcave, anucleate discs, 7nm diameter in mammals._(trans-FYOO-zhun) The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed._The psychological or physiological need to take a substance in oder to experience its effects or to avoid the effects of its absence.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Red blood cells. Mature erythrocytes are non-nucleated, biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.:(trans-FYOO-zhun) The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed.

Concepts.definition: A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.

(trans-FYOO-zhun) The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed.
The psychological or physiological need to take a substance in order to experience its effects or to avoid the effects of its absence.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed._The psychological or physiological need to take a substance in order to experience its effects or to avoid the effects of its absence._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.: A natural number greater than 15 and less than 17 and the quantity that it denotes.: Any period of seven consecutive days.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0: Cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm and little else; biconcave, anucleate discs, 7nm diameter in mammals.: The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed.

Concepts.definition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
A natural number greater than 15 and less than 17 and the quantity that it denotes.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.
The injection of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Generally defined as 3-7 RBC units in 16 weeks in at least 2 transfusion episodes, maximum 3 in 8 weeks.

Concepts.definition: Generally defined as 3-7 RBC units in 16 weeks in at least 2 transfusion episodes, maximum 3 in 8 weeks.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Generally defined as greater than or equal to 8 RBC units in 16 weeks, greater than or equal to 4 transfusion episodes in 8 weeks.

Concepts.definition: Generally defined as greater than or equal to 8 RBC units in 16 weeks, greater than or equal to 4 transfusion episodes in 8 weeks.
